coverage: Malachi audits post‑exilic covenant life through disputations: divine love and election (Jacob–Esau), priestly negligence, marriage treachery, theodicy, tithes and storehouse obedience, and the promised messenger(s) leading to a refining theophany. It climaxes in the Day of the LORD with the Sun of righteousness for those who fear the name, Torah remembrance, and Elijah’s return.
id_scheme: Cross-book stable by (type+primary-slug) + deterministic hash; alias reuse for shared entities.

entries.name: Malachi
entries.blurb: Post-exilic prophet framing covenant audit through disputation oracles; name/title underscores messenger theme.

entries.name: Governor (Persian administration)
entries.blurb: Persian-appointed administrator whose table becomes a rhetorical test for offering quality.

entries.name: Priests
entries.blurb: Charged with teaching Torah and guarding holiness; indicted for despising the name and corrupt instruction.

entries.name: Levites
entries.blurb: Bearers of the covenant with Levi—idealized for fear, truthful instruction, and turning many from iniquity.

entries.name: Men of Judah
entries.blurb: Addressed regarding syncretistic marriages and treacherous divorce that covers one’s garment with violence.

entries.name: Scribes/Recorders
entries.blurb: Implicit functionaries as the Book of Remembrance is written for those who fear the LORD.

entries.name: Those who fear the LORD
entries.blurb: Community that speaks together; marked for remembrance and treasured possession.

entries.name: Elijah
entries.blurb: Promised precursor who turns hearts, prefiguring renewal and reconciliation.

entries.name: Messenger of the covenant (figure-link)
entries.blurb: Linked to theophany and temple; identity debated in reception history.

entries.name: Israel
entries.blurb: Primary audience of the disputations; called back to covenant fidelity.

entries.name: Judah
entries.blurb: Indicted for profaning the sanctuary and covenant through marriage practices and treachery.

entries.name: Remnant
entries.blurb: Those who fear the LORD; distinguished in the day that is coming.

entries.name: Nations
entries.blurb: Witnesses to Israel’s worship and blessing; envisioned as acknowledging the LORD’s great name.

entries.name: Profaners of the sanctuary
entries.blurb: Violators who marry the daughter of a foreign god, desecrating the beloved sanctuary.

entries.name: Robbers of God
entries.blurb: Withholders of tithes and contributions; bring themselves under a curse.

entries.name: Arrogant & evildoers
entries.blurb: Seemingly prosperous yet destined for stubble in the coming Day.

entries.name: Blessed by the nations
entries.blurb: Outcome of covenant obedience—Israel called blessed and land delightsome.

entries.name: YHWH (the LORD)
entries.blurb: Great King whose name is to be feared among the nations; unchanging in covenant justice and mercy.

entries.name: The messenger of the covenant
entries.note: Interpretations vary: angelic, theophanic, or messianic; treated here as divine title with figure cross-link.
entries.blurb: The Lord whom you seek comes suddenly to his temple to purify and judge.

entries.name: Superscription
entries.blurb: ‘Oracle. The word of the LORD to Israel by Malachi’—frames the disputation style.

entries.name: Name/title debate: Malachi (“my messenger”)
entries.blurb: Explores titular vs. proper-name readings and thematic links to messenger motif.

entries.name: Disputation formula: You say… But I say…
entries.blurb: Dialogic pattern structuring accusation, objection, and divine rebuttal across the book.

entries.name: I have loved you / How have you loved us?
entries.blurb: Opening contestation of divine love resolved in election history.

entries.name: Jacob–Esau election
entries.blurb: Divine preference of Jacob; theological axis for covenant identity.

entries.name: Edom: territory of wickedness
entries.blurb: Oracle against Edom as emblem of persistent opposition to God.

entries.name: Edom’s rebuilding thwarted
entries.blurb: Human rebuilding plans frustrated by divine demolition—naming them ‘wicked land.’

entries.name: Great King among the nations
entries.blurb: God’s name magnified among the nations; anticipates universal worship.

entries.name: Polluted offerings / Contemptible altar
entries.blurb: Blind, lame, and sick animals expose disdain for the LORD’s table.

entries.name: Covenant with Levi (ideal)
entries.blurb: Levi’s fear, truthful lips, and turning from iniquity as priestly norm.

entries.name: Corrupt priestly instruction
entries.blurb: Instruction causes many to stumble; favoritism and partiality corrode justice.

entries.name: Priestly lips/knowledge should preserve Torah
entries.blurb: Priests as knowledge-keepers and YHWH’s messengers for the people.

entries.name: Faithless Judah: daughter of a foreign god
entries.blurb: Mixed marriages framed as covenant betrayal and sanctuary profanation.

entries.name: Faithless Judah: divorce & violence
entries.note: Translation variants on 2:16 are noted across traditions.
entries.blurb: Treachery against covenant wives; violence imagery covers one’s garment.

entries.name: Profaning the sanctuary which he loves
entries.blurb: Desecration of the sacred sphere via unfaithful unions.

entries.name: Wearied the LORD with words / Where is justice?
entries.blurb: Misreading divine patience as indifference provokes corrective theophany.

entries.name: Behold, I send my messenger
entries.blurb: Preparatory figure clearing the way before the Lord.

entries.name: Sudden coming to his temple
entries.blurb: The Lord/ messenger of the covenant arrives in judgment and purification.

entries.name: Messenger of the covenant (theophany focus)
entries.blurb: Temple-focused arrival tied to refining priests and purifying worship.

entries.name: Who can endure the day of his coming?
entries.blurb: Threshold question introducing refiner and launderer images.

entries.name: Refiner’s fire
entries.blurb: Smelting image for removing dross from priesthood and people.

entries.name: Launderer’s soap
entries.blurb: Cleansing metaphor complementing the refiner’s furnace.

entries.name: Offerings in righteousness
entries.blurb: Purified worship acceptable as in former days and years of old.

entries.name: Court list of indictments (3:5)
entries.blurb: Sorcery, adultery, false swearing, wage oppression, and injustice toward the vulnerable.

entries.name: Return to me and I will return to you
entries.blurb: Reciprocal covenant invitation anchoring the tithes appeal.

entries.name: How have we robbed God? Tithes & offerings
entries.blurb: Dialog exposes covenant theft and invites restoration.

entries.name: Storehouse test
entries.blurb: Bring the full tithe and see if blessing flows.

entries.name: Windows of heaven opened
entries.blurb: Heaven’s bounty poured out without measure.

entries.name: Devourer rebuked
entries.blurb: Pest/crop-destroyer restrained; agriculture flourishes.

entries.name: All nations will call you blessed
entries.blurb: Reputation among nations restored through covenant faithfulness.

entries.name: Land of delight
entries.blurb: The land becomes a delight—Edenic resonance under faithful economy.

entries.name: Hard words against God / Prosper of arrogant
entries.blurb: Misread prosperity and cynical speech confronted by divine record-keeping.

entries.name: Book of Remembrance written
entries.blurb: Divine memorial for those who fear the LORD and esteem his name.

entries.name: My treasured possession (segullah)
entries.blurb: Covenant endearment term signaling special ownership and protection.

entries.name: Distinction between righteous and wicked
entries.blurb: Clear moral differentiation reinstated by divine judgment.

entries.name: Day of the LORD: oven burning like a furnace
entries.blurb: Arrogant and evildoers reduced to stubble in total judgment.

entries.name: Neither root nor branch left
entries.blurb: Completeness of destruction motif; no hope for wicked structures.

entries.name: Sun of righteousness with healing in its wings
entries.blurb: Radiant vindication and healing for those who fear the name.

entries.name: Going out leaping like calves
entries.blurb: Pastoral freedom image epitomizing restored life.

entries.name: Tread down the wicked / Ashes under your feet
entries.blurb: Victory image where former oppressors become ash underfoot.

entries.name: Remember the Torah of Moses
entries.blurb: Mosaic instruction commands covenant memory at the canon’s seam.

entries.name: Mount Horeb/Sinai recall
entries.blurb: Sinai event invoked to ground present obedience.

entries.name: Behold, I send Elijah
entries.blurb: Prophetic return heralding the great and awesome Day of the LORD.

entries.name: Hearts of fathers to children & children to fathers
entries.blurb: Relational restoration preventing total devastation—social fruit of repentance.

entries.name: Temple
entries.blurb: Locus of sudden theophany and storehouse-centered obedience.

entries.name: Altar
entries.blurb: Despised table revealed by blemished offerings and tear-stained supplications.

entries.name: Table of the LORD
entries.blurb: Metonym for altar service; called ‘contemptible’ by corrupt priests.

entries.name: Blind animals
entries.blurb: Unacceptable sacrifices that dishonor the Great King.

entries.name: Lame animals
entries.blurb: Defective offerings illustrating priestly negligence.

entries.name: Sick animals
entries.blurb: Polluted gifts forbidden by Torah and rebuked by the prophet.

entries.name: Tear-covered altar
entries.blurb: Weeping and groaning fail to mask covenant treachery.

entries.name: Covenant with Levi (entity)
entries.blurb: Formal bond characterized by life, peace, fear, and truthful instruction.

entries.name: Priestly lips/knowledge (ideal syllabus)
entries.blurb: Repository of Torah expected from priestly office.

entries.name: Sanctuary (which he loves)
entries.blurb: Beloved sphere profaned by unfaithful unions.

entries.name: Daughter of a foreign god (motif)
entries.blurb: Marriage that compromises covenant fidelity and communal holiness.

entries.name: Divorce certificate
entries.blurb: Legal instrument implicated in treacherous dismissals.

entries.name: Violence covers one’s garment
entries.blurb: Graphic idiom for harm done through marital treachery.

entries.name: Storehouse
entries.blurb: Temple depot for tithes provisioning priests and the poor.

entries.name: Tithes
entries.blurb: Covenant contributions withheld by the people—central test case of fidelity.

entries.name: Offerings
entries.blurb: Accompany tithes; their neglect constitutes robbery against God.

entries.name: Windows of heaven
entries.blurb: Heavenly sluices pouring down abundance on obedience.

entries.name: Devourer
entries.blurb: Crop-destroying force rebuked by the LORD when tithes are restored.

entries.name: Book of Remembrance
entries.blurb: Scroll recording names of those who fear the LORD; ties to wider ‘books’ tradition.

entries.name: Treasured possession (segullah)
entries.blurb: Covenant term of endearment echoing Exodus 19:5; signals special status.

entries.name: Oven/Furnace
entries.blurb: Apocalyptic heat symbol consuming the wicked like stubble.

entries.name: Stubble
entries.blurb: Dry, flammable residue signifying the fate of the arrogant.

entries.name: Ashes
entries.blurb: Aftermath of the Day when the wicked are trodden underfoot.

entries.name: Sun of righteousness
entries.blurb: Solar image for vindication and healing to those who fear the name.

entries.name: Wings (healing)
entries.blurb: Healing reaches like sunbeams/‘wings’ from the righteous sun.

entries.name: Land of delight
entries.blurb: Transformed territory under covenant blessing.

entries.name: Governor’s table
entries.blurb: Rhetorical benchmark for acceptable gifts—if not fit for the governor, not fit for God.

entries.name: Incense and pure offering among the nations
entries.blurb: Universal reverence motif with diverse interpretations (prayer, spiritual sacrifices, eschatological worship).

entries.name: Edom’s ruins/desolation
entries.blurb: A desolate wasteland despite rebuilding attempts—marker of divine opposition.

entries.name: Justice triad: orphan, widow, sojourner
entries.blurb: Litmus group for covenant fidelity in legal practice.

entries.name: Perjury
entries.blurb: False swearing undercuts justice and community trust.

entries.name: Sorcery
entries.blurb: Illicit power-seeking condemned in the covenant lawsuit.

entries.name: Adultery
entries.blurb: Sexual unfaithfulness linked to broader covenant treachery.

entries.name: Oppression of wage earner
entries.blurb: Withholding or exploiting laborers—central justice infraction.

entries.name: Election love (Jacob–Esau)
entries.blurb: Divine love/election as covenant foundation rather than sentimentalism.

entries.name: Priestly vocation & catechesis
entries.blurb: Priests as teachers and guardians of knowledge for communal holiness.

entries.name: Sanctuary holiness vs. profanation
entries.blurb: Boundaries around sacred life threatened by syncretism and treachery.

entries.name: Marriage covenant ethics
entries.blurb: Faithfulness and nonviolence as covenant essentials within the home.

entries.name: Theodicy and divine patience
entries.blurb: God’s timing and record-keeping answer cynical narratives of injustice.

entries.name: Tithes & covenant economics
entries.blurb: Material obedience integrates worship, justice, and communal provision.

entries.name: Refiner’s fire as purgation
entries.blurb: Judgment serves purification toward acceptable worship.

entries.name: Day of the LORD in Malachi
entries.blurb: Final separation culminating in restoration joy and wickedness as ash.

entries.name: Universal worship: incense/pure offering (1:11) interpretations
entries.blurb: Jewish and Christian readings span eschatological sacrifices, prayer, and Eucharistic imagery.

entries.name: Book of Remembrance & heavenly books
entries.blurb: Malachi’s scroll aligns with apocalyptic records of deeds and names.

entries.name: Segullah (treasured possession) theology
entries.blurb: Echo of Sinai covenant identity shaping communal assurance.

entries.name: Elijah typology and John the Baptist
entries.blurb: Forerunner motif flowing into NT identification and apocalyptic witness patterns.

entries.name: Sirach 48 reception of Elijah
entries.blurb: Ben Sira extols Elijah’s end-time role, cementing expectation of his return.

entries.name: Malachi as prophetic seam to the Gospels
entries.blurb: Torah remembrance and Elijah promise bridge Tanakh to Gospel narratives.
